newsitem.title: UK: INSIGHT -Stg set to go lower, eyes 2.74 mark goal.
newsitem.headline: INSIGHT -Stg set to go lower, eyes 2.74 mark goal.

text.p: Sterling's decline this week against the mark is expected to continue, testing initial support at the round-figure 2.74 before breaking lower.

"Sterling/mark is beginning to break down, short-term supports have broken and it's now looking like we're heading to the 2.7267 trendline," said Norman Beauchamp, head of derivatives at the Cooperative Bank.

Below here, the May 12 low of 2.7240 is the next downside target. Minor round-figure and congestive support cuts in around the 2.72 and 2.70 levels but the next major target is the mid-March low of 2.6580 marks.
